programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Follow along as Mark Peterson travels to Tanzania to hunt the Eastern and Western White-Bearded Wildebeest. These animals are known for their distinctive white beards and large horns, making them a sought-after trophy for hunters on an African safari. Mark sets out on an exciting and thrilling adventure to track down these elusive creatures in the plains of Tanzania.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson on an epic hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of New Zealand as he goes after Whitetail deer. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd have to borrow a trusty rifle from his guide, Shawn. Get ready for heart-pounding action, breathtaking scenery, and valuable tips and tricks from a seasoned hunter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in New Zealand, but this time, after a Wapiti. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd again have to borrow from his guide, Shawn. Elk were first introduced to New Zealand in 1909 when President Roosevelt gifted a herd of 20 animals that were released on the South Island. Get ready to immerse yourself in the beauty of nature that New Zealand has to offer.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson sets his sights on a Free-Range New Zealand Red Stag, but it doesn't come easy. Dense fog, steep terrain, and thick vegetation make finding a mature stag no easy task. Watch as Mark Peterson and his guide cover the gorgeous New Zealand landscape in search of one of the most sought-after big game animals on the South Island of New Zealand. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd again have to borrow from his guide.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP finds the Largemouth Bass keyed into only one specific pattern this mid fall day.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads back into Florida Bay with Captain Richard Black in search of Redfish, Snook and whatever else they run into using all artificial baits.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP Heads to the Dot Lawrence River to target Springtime Smallmouth Bass on small Swimbaits.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP Works with a BFS (Bait Finesse System) to cast micro crankbaits for pre-spawn Smallmouth Bass.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch hes helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed Buddy.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mindcatching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesnt take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After purchasing his very first Kansas farm, Shawn and his good friend Cole set out to transform it into a true whitetail paradise. Years of hard work, dedication, and habitat improvement finally pay off when Shawn takes on a challenge hes never faced beforeharvesting a whitetail buck on the ground with no blind! Filming adds another layer of difficulty, but the reward is more than worth it. In an unforgettable hunt, Shawn is able to harvest a giant 9.5-year-old Kansas buck, making this a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Captiva island is the land of giants. Snook, permit and tarpon are on todays agenda.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike fishes from safety harbor with Capt. Mikey Rogal for the coveted inshore slam.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to one of the most prolific fisheries in SW Florida; South Seas Island Resort.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the space coast for a mixed bag of drum.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA fishes the ultra shallow ponds in Flagler beach for reds and snook.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: Tanner and CA put their power fishing skills to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to Jupiter to fish with Ryan Nitz for giant snook.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is in Flamingo, Everglades National Park, in search of silver and gold.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: From Miami to Apalachicola Bay, Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss revisits some of his favorite moments from this season.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss and Captain James Hillman are heading out of Highland Park Fish Camp in Deland, Florida, looking for largemouth bass.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Its the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark Cheech Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff & Cole of Buckventures TV, are back in Oklahoma with one big goalcatching up with the buck they call That 170. With a cold front rolling in, they waste no time hanging stands and getting in position for the action. Jeff breaks out the WoodHaven Intimidator grunt call and sets the stage with a decoy, hoping to pull the giant into bow range.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten Scroggins and the whole family return to the blind to see if they can call one of the other gobblers back in to their setup. A family that hunts together stays together!
Adam Hays is no stranger to world class bucks, but last year ittook patience and determination to harvest this Illinois giant with3 days left in the season!
Tarif Alkhatibs is new to Team200, but no stranger to killing someof the biggest free range whitetails in his home state of Texas including the state record typical!

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: With two out of the five tags filled, The Bearded Buck Crew is on a roll. With a day and a half left, J-Rod and Austin are feeling the pressure.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Were headed to the Midwest for a December waterfowl grind. First stop: Kansas, chasing ducks with the crew from Dirtys Outerwear. Then Cole Barthel jumps south to Oklahoma to squeeze in one more hunt before Christmas break.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree travels back to Arkansas and joins Rusty Creasey to hunt late season ducks.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Waterfowl crew heads to Arkansas to hunt mallards in the timber. Rusty Creasey hosts Tyler and Colton Jordan, and Cole Barthel for an epic duck hunt.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a bucks decision to stayor stray.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is wrapping up his Argentina hunt and heading to Entre Rios to track down the final two birds on his list: the Rock Pigeon and the Eared Dove. This area is home to over 10 million birds, making it a prime hunting ground. With flocks of pigeons and doves filling the skies, Mark is set for a fast-paced, action-packed finish to his hunta perfect end to an unforgettable adventure.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: With over 20 years of service, retiring as a Senior Chief Machinery Technician, Steven served abord multiple Coast Guard cutters, led critical missions, protected our nation's leaders, and earned the Coast Guard Achievement Medal for his outstanding service. Beyond the uniform, Steven has has spent decades giving back - coaching youth sports, mentoring young athletes, and living the values of service, leadership, and integrity. Steven's dedication didn't end with retirement - and neither does our gratitude. We were honored to have Steven at Thumbtack Ranch and are even more grateful for his service.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts weve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. Youll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know youll love it.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: LBP Spotlights Internet Personality and YouTube Star Lawson Lindsey as he searches for trophy fish at the Headwaters of the Loxahatchee River.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: TA Mahoney is a classic mom and pop store known for going the extra mile and treating everyday people like family. Keep an eye on Mike though, you never know what kind of prank is up his sleeve.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna own the most prolific tackle shop in Fort Walton Beach. Josh's family eats, sleeps and breathes fishing.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Meet just a few of the amazing crew members of the Old Salt Board of Directors. This nonprofit is more than just a fishing group. They make a difference in their community.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and the new producer (Tim Guidroz) go out on their first turkey hunt together, and even though the weather is not ideal, they get the job done on a Wilkinson County gobbler. We also get a look at what the United Country - Southern States Realty office looks like during turkey season, with interviews from Scott Lindsey and Caleb Armstrong, and three big properties closing in Baton Rouge.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: On this episode of Hunting Land Man Season 3, Slade puts in some early summer farm work to Ensure his target bucks are well fed! Slade also Talks about his Target buck for the year, "Pope"! Slade is laying the trap early in hopes "Pope" makes a mistake early!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhats involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade goes over what hes doing at his home property to create summer food plots for deer, and gives tips to those looking to do the same. On the final hunt for the 2024 season, Lori gets a big Wilkinson County gobbler.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Florida, where we stop in Jacksonville, Jupiter, Boca Raton and Miami!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Florida, where we stop in Key West, Marathon, Bonita Springs, and Sanibel Island.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Texas is the home to many exotic species that can be hunted. One species in particular, Axis, have a very large population. Our team got together and had a great time hanging out with a land owner and hunting Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyders life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something youd see in a moviein fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberlys story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We follow along with the crew from Struttinbuck on their annual Father Son hunt at FE Hill. No matter what happens throughout the year this is always a must have trip and a time to settle down and enjoy the great outdoors.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Blair and Leiza Fitzgerrald search the Indian River Lagoon for redfish to tag for the CCA STAR Tournament.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Hunter Bach takes Blair to the northern part of the Indian River to catch redfish.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads out of Cape Canaveral with an old friend Capt. Scott Lum looking for triple tail and Cobia.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: When Blair heads down to Louisiana to fish, it's usually with Capt. Mike Frenette and it's usually for big redfish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Northern Maine to hunt for moose and learn about the conservation of this species which is under attack by winter ticks. Can reducing moose numbers be the key to saving the local moose population from this deadly parasite?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green is joined by his childhood friends in his home state of Michigan for a trout fishing adventure. They visit the most dynamic landmarks in the Upper Peninsula, do a little cliff jumping, and finish out the trip cooking trout riverside.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff embark on a 20-day mission into the Everglades to find the invasive pythons that are plaguing the ecosystem. These apex predators have eliminated more than 90% of fur-bearing animals in their new home. Can they turn the tide, or is the Everglades already lost?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Were headed to the Midwest for a December waterfowl grind. First stop: Kansas, chasing ducks with the crew from Dirtys Outerwear. Then Cole Barthel jumps south to Oklahoma to squeeze in one more hunt before Christmas break.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Black Cloud joins The Fowl Life TV at WyoBraska Outfitters. Chad Belding and his team take us along as they hunt Canadian Geese in the Great Plains.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Cole Barthel is back home hunting with family and friends in the Louisiana Timber.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew heads to the timber of Arkansas to hunt with good friends in an old blind thats seen many unbelievable hunts throughout the years.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree travels back to Arkansas and joins Rusty Creasey to hunt late season ducks.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew makes a quick trip to Northern Texas and hunt a small farm pond they've had success in in the past. As any duck hunter knows, duck hunts don't always go as planned!!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Snow and ice north of Oklahoma help Team Realtree have a successful opening day hunt to kick off the Federal Black Cloud duck hunting season.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: With duck seasons coming to a close across the country, Realtree's crews heads to East Central Louisiana to hunt ducks at Honey Brake Lodge. There's still plenty of ducks in the area after the arctic cold snap the affected the country, and it shows!!!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin Leake and Meredith McCord divert attention from whats not happening with the tarpon bite to using CoastMaster, light tackle and experience to find snapper success on heavily fished public spots.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela dives into the heart of one of the worlds largest game reserves - the Selous. He explores the synergy between hunting and conservation that is preserving this wild paradise.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Join Dan Cabela in New Zealand's breathtaking landscapes as he hunts non-native species, delving into the crucial role of controlled harvesting and the complexities of managing introduced wildlife.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Explore Pakistan's wilderness with Dan Cabela as he treks the rugged mountains, in search of ibex and urial, and learns about the community conservation model that has protected these species.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Discover the pressing threat of Chronic Wasting Disease in North American whitetail deer and the fierce debate around the strategies aimed at its management.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justins boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the worlds luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect locals day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's 2016 and Mark heads down to Kansas for an early season Muzzleloader Whitetail hunt with Salt River Outfitters. It was hot in the stand with little deer movement until the moon phase switched and one of the bucks Mark had been looking for stepped out. Kansas is one of those states that has an early Muzzleloader season that opens in September, and if you can get the weather and the moon to align you can catch a big deer on his feet in daylight.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Follow along as Mark Peterson travels to Tanzania to hunt the Eastern and Western White-Bearded Wildebeest. These animals are known for their distinctive white beards and large horns, making them a sought-after trophy for hunters on an African safari. Mark sets out on an exciting and thrilling adventure to track down these elusive creatures in the plains of Tanzania.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson on an epic hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of New Zealand as he goes after Whitetail deer. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd have to borrow a trusty rifle from his guide, Shawn. Get ready for heart-pounding action, breathtaking scenery, and valuable tips and tricks from a seasoned hunter.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark continues his quest in New Zealand, but this time, after a Wapiti. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd again have to borrow from his guide, Shawn. Elk were first introduced to New Zealand in 1909 when President Roosevelt gifted a herd of 20 animals that were released on the South Island. Get ready to immerse yourself in the beauty of nature that New Zealand has to offer.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: In this episode, Mark Peterson chases after a Red Stag, Black Buck and Fallow deer. Theres no shortage of action in this video. Argentina's borders were closed during the peak of COVID, so these animals have not been hunted for two years, which led to a game rich environment and excellent trophy quality. On this adventure, Mark is joined by his dad Earl, brother Aaron and nephew Alec to chase some of the biggest free-range Red Stags in the world. Stay tuned for more on this family adventure in Argentina.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson sets his sights on a Free-Range New Zealand Red Stag, but it doesn't come easy. Dense fog, steep terrain, and thick vegetation make finding a mature stag no easy task. Watch as Mark Peterson and his guide cover the gorgeous New Zealand landscape in search of one of the most sought-after big game animals on the South Island of New Zealand. On this hunt, Mark was unable to get his firearms import permit in time to take his Gunwerks rifle, so he'd again have to borrow from his guide.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark's quest for the South America Waterfowl Slam has now taken him to Peru where he finds a surprising density of Cinnamon Teal. Although he already checked this species off the list in Argentina, his first hunt in Peru proves to be one of the best Cinnamon Teal shoots of his life. This is only the first afternoon and there are 5 days left to hunt the remaining 7 species.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP finds the Largemouth Bass keyed into only one specific pattern this mid fall day.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads back into Florida Bay with Captain Richard Black in search of Redfish, Snook and whatever else they run into using all artificial baits.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP Heads to the Dot Lawrence River to target Springtime Smallmouth Bass on small Swimbaits.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP Works with a BFS (Bait Finesse System) to cast micro crankbaits for pre-spawn Smallmouth Bass.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stopsgetting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Callto turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch hes helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed Buddy.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mindcatching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesnt take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After purchasing his very first Kansas farm, Shawn and his good friend Cole set out to transform it into a true whitetail paradise. Years of hard work, dedication, and habitat improvement finally pay off when Shawn takes on a challenge hes never faced beforeharvesting a whitetail buck on the ground with no blind! Filming adds another layer of difficulty, but the reward is more than worth it. In an unforgettable hunt, Shawn is able to harvest a giant 9.5-year-old Kansas buck, making this a once-in-a-lifetime experience.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Captiva island is the land of giants. Snook, permit and tarpon are on todays agenda.

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.desc: CA heads to the space coast for a mixed bag of drum.

programme.desc: CA fishes the ultra shallow ponds in Flagler beach for reds and snook.

programme.title: Captain's Log

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Its the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark Cheech Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Bonefish & Tarpon Trust
programme.desc: Watch the video to learn more about bonefish and tarpon connectivity and the importance of conservation at local and regional levels.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff & Cole of Buckventures TV, are back in Oklahoma with one big goalcatching up with the buck they call That 170. With a cold front rolling in, they waste no time hanging stands and getting in position for the action. Jeff breaks out the WoodHaven Intimidator grunt call and sets the stage with a decoy, hoping to pull the giant into bow range.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten Scroggins and the whole family return to the blind to see if they can call one of the other gobblers back in to their setup. A family that hunts together stays together!
Adam Hays is no stranger to world class bucks, but last year ittook patience and determination to harvest this Illinois giant with3 days left in the season!
Tarif Alkhatibs is new to Team200, but no stranger to killing someof the biggest free range whitetails in his home state of Texas including the state record typical!

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: With two out of the five tags filled, The Bearded Buck Crew is on a roll. With a day and a half left, J-Rod and Austin are feeling the pressure.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Were headed to the Midwest for a December waterfowl grind. First stop: Kansas, chasing ducks with the crew from Dirtys Outerwear. Then Cole Barthel jumps south to Oklahoma to squeeze in one more hunt before Christmas break.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree travels back to Arkansas and joins Rusty Creasey to hunt late season ducks.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Waterfowl crew heads to Arkansas to hunt mallards in the timber. Rusty Creasey hosts Tyler and Colton Jordan, and Cole Barthel for an epic duck hunt.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a bucks decision to stayor stray.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is wrapping up his Argentina hunt and heading to Entre Rios to track down the final two birds on his list: the Rock Pigeon and the Eared Dove. This area is home to over 10 million birds, making it a prime hunting ground. With flocks of pigeons and doves filling the skies, Mark is set for a fast-paced, action-packed finish to his hunta perfect end to an unforgettable adventure.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: With over 20 years of service, retiring as a Senior Chief Machinery Technician, Steven served abord multiple Coast Guard cutters, led critical missions, protected our nation's leaders, and earned the Coast Guard Achievement Medal for his outstanding service. Beyond the uniform, Steven has has spent decades giving back - coaching youth sports, mentoring young athletes, and living the values of service, leadership, and integrity. Steven's dedication didn't end with retirement - and neither does our gratitude. We were honored to have Steven at Thumbtack Ranch and are even more grateful for his service.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts weve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. Youll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know youll love it.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: LBP Spotlights Internet Personality and YouTube Star Lawson Lindsey as he searches for trophy fish at the Headwaters of the Loxahatchee River.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: TA Mahoney is a classic mom and pop store known for going the extra mile and treating everyday people like family. Keep an eye on Mike though, you never know what kind of prank is up his sleeve.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Josh and his wife Anna own the most prolific tackle shop in Fort Walton Beach. Josh's family eats, sleeps and breathes fishing.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Meet just a few of the amazing crew members of the Old Salt Board of Directors. This nonprofit is more than just a fishing group. They make a difference in their community.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and the new producer (Tim Guidroz) go out on their first turkey hunt together, and even though the weather is not ideal, they get the job done on a Wilkinson County gobbler. We also get a look at what the United Country - Southern States Realty office looks like during turkey season, with interviews from Scott Lindsey and Caleb Armstrong, and three big properties closing in Baton Rouge.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man
programme.desc: On this episode of Hunting Land Man Season 3, Slade puts in some early summer farm work to Ensure his target bucks are well fed! Slade also Talks about his Target buck for the year, "Pope"! Slade is laying the trap early in hopes "Pope" makes a mistake early!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhats involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade takes Bentley on his very first duck hunt. Slade also gets to take a trip to duck hunting paradise with some great buddies of his. This episode is all about having a great time with great friends.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade goes over what hes doing at his home property to create summer food plots for deer, and gives tips to those looking to do the same. On the final hunt for the 2024 season, Lori gets a big Wilkinson County gobbler.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.
